title: Content Marketing - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: rmccarley February 12, 2007 Power to the People! 7 Tips for Using Your Voice Online Content Marketing When you write with your own voice you can break through to the reader on an emotional level. This gives them a tangible connection with you. This also enhances the user experience by letting them know there is a real human being in the company and it adds personality to your website. When working with a medium as impersonal as a website having a voice can be a real comfort and build ... Read this post J By: Jason Murphy February 9, 2007 Put the YOU in YOUmoz: Suggestions and Feedback. Content Marketing What can I say? I'm a YOUmoz junkie! I can only imagine that SEOmoz V3 is being viewed as a major success by the SEOmoz crew. From a third-party perspective, it appears that comments have dramatically increased (although there was a little RingBait that also sucked in many warrented and well-deserv... Read this post C By: Ciaran Norris February 8, 2007 This boring headline was written for the readers Content Marketing Back in April of last year, the New York Times published an article titled "This Boring Headline Was Written For Google." In the article, Steve Lohr described how journalists have to take search engines into account when composing their titles. Read this post S By: stevenp February 6, 2007 Blogging to Boost a Site Content Marketing Blogging can help a site improve its ranking, visibility, and community. When it comes to indexing, it isn't that uncommon for search engines spiders to ignore parts of a site -- particularly if a site has hundreds or thousands of pages. At times site owners don't want pages indexed, but there are a fair share of those out there who are frustrated that some pages ar... Read this post S By: stevenp February 6, 2007 SEO is all about you Content Marketing The customer is always right and should be the focus of any business or organization -- on-line or not. Good SEOs know that. I've been in SEO for about a year now. As someone whose only Internet experience -- beyond websurfing, e-mail, and buying and selling stuff -- was an itty bit of blogging and a short beginning HTML course coupled with no marketing or ad... Read this post E By: EGOL February 3, 2007 Ten Types of Blog Managers - Which One are You? Content Marketing What type of blog manager are you? Mr. Packrat? Miss Self-Contained? Your style of blog management can make your blog an SEO powerhouse, a great resource for visitors, or an intellectual property graveyard. Check out these management styles and comment on which one you think is best! 1) PACK RAT:Blogs at full speed ahead. Never checks to see if h... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley January 14, 2007 Hey, I'm Blogging! Pay Attention to Me! Content Marketing Rand sent me the above comic strip and instructed me to let it inspire me (it seems he enjoys giving me the occasional homework assignment), and the first thing I thought of when I read it was, "Why do people blog?" I read a lot of SEO blogs (arou... Read this post E By: Ella_D December 20, 2006 Pligg: a CMS framework to build digg-like sites Content Marketing Wow! At least one (probably the only one, hehe) of Rand's predictions is already coming true. There has been, for a while now (more than a year from what I heard), a CMS that allows you to build Digg-like platforms: PLIGG. And let me tell you, there is a bizarre TREND in most of the names - most of them are utterly funny with their &q... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 19, 2006 Everything in the Digg, Reddit & Netscape Algorithms Content Marketing At work today, Matt noted that he found Digg's algorithm far more interesting than Google's. I was shocked - after all, Digg isn't nearly as complex or widely used as Google, but with its rising popularity in the tech space, I could, at least, empathize with why he might feel that way. I also took it as a challenge to expose all the possible elements that might be in an algorithm at ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 22, 2006 Oh Reddit, Thy Mystery is Infinite Content Marketing Most folks who hadn't heard of Reddit before November certainly have now. With the sale to Conde Nast, Reddit has joined the ranks of social media property successes (congrats, BTW to Paul Graham & Y Combinator). To a web marketer, though, Reddit remains an enigma shrouded in a mystery, encapsulated in a cute little robot: ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 6, 2006 Linkbait Success Rates & Digg's New, Tougher Algo Content Marketing Last week, Neil Patel reported that Digg is making it harder to get Dugg. I can certainly vouch for that. An ex-client and friend of ours launched what was (at least in my opinion) a highly Digg-worthy article on the Ten Servers ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 1, 2006 Those Pesky Social Bookmarking Buttons on Blogs Content Marketing At the 37 Signals blog, Matt is discussing the efficacy of having buttons for Digg, Del.icio.us, Reddit, etc. listed on the bottom of article pages or blog posts. Here's what he had to say: Given the Ebola-like spread of these things they must be reall... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 1, 2006 10 Web Tools to Help Generate Blog Content Ideas Content Marketing In order to remain in their audience's good graces, bloggers need great posts - and that means they need great ideas. SEOmoz has produced an average of more than 2 unique posts each day for the last couple years (~1500 posts over ~740 days) - but it's no easy task. Sometimes ideas for content come to you and it feels as though you can't write enough. Other days, yo... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 5, 2006 Comparing Visit Data for Shoemoney & SEOmoz over 12 Months Content Marketing I was completely blown away by Jeremy's recent release of his site statistics. Since coming to popularity in the Spring of this year, Jeremy has been one of the most succesful traffic-growth stories in the blogosphere and certainly the search community. Below, I've taken his numbers and added our own: ... Read this post
